title.native: パンプキン・シザーズ

description:
Alice Malvin commands a military propaganda unit, but she idealistically yearns to cut through the deception. When she uncovers a super-soldier program known as The Invisible Nine, she finds herself trapped in a web of deadly secrets. Malvin turns to an unlikely ally—Randel Orland, a hulking veteran who may hold the key to unlocking the mysteries of The Invisible Nine.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Twitter](http://twitter.com/uedakana) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uedakana69/)

__Non-anime roles:__
• Yoimiya - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Hera - Aether Gazer (VG)
• Fu Ji - Mahjong Soul (VG)
• Cermia - Epic 7 (VG)
• Melania - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
• Carlotta - Wuthering Waves (VG)

[Profile](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/9) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kowotani)

After graduating from university, he became a founding member of Yuji Saito's music production company IMAGINE in November 1986. The company has grown to feature musicians like Kohei Tanaka, Shiro Hamaguchi, Hayato Matsuo, and Shinji Miyazaki, who have become well known for cinematic scoring and orchestration through Otani. 

In 1987, he made his debut as an anime composer with the popular manga adaptation City Hunter, which earned him recognition in the industry. He later went on to work on titles such as Spy Games (1988), The Ultimate Teacher (1988), The Yadamura Waltz (1988), and You're Under Arrest (1994). The anime Future GPX Cyber Formula (1991) and Mobile Suit Gundam Wing (1995) and several films in the Gamera series are some of his most well-known works.  In 2001, he created the score to the film Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack. Other notable scores by Otani include Outlaw Star (1998), Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz (1998), Cross Fire (2000), The SoulTaker (2001), Haibane Renmei (2002), Zatch Bell! (2003), Eyeshield 21 (2005), Pumpkin Scissors (2006), Deltora Quest (2007), and Over Drive (2007). He has also been the music director and keyboardist of the band Dreams Come True. He appeared at Eminence Symphony Orchestra's events A Night in Fantasia 2007: Symphonic Games Edition and Unearthing Eden ~The sounds of AINARU~ in 2007.  

Throughout his career, Otani has also composed music for several video games, making his debut with the 1995 shooter game Philosoma. In 2000, he created the soundtrack to the flight simulator Sky Odyssey. He scored Shadow of the Colossus in 2005, his most famous video game work. Otani was responsible for composing the music for Wild Arms: Twilight Venom (2000), an anime adaptation of the Wild Arms video game series; he also arranged compositions of Michiko Naruke's music from the series. He did two more video game to anime adaptations: Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge (1997) and Popolocrois Monogatari (1998). In 2005, he created the track "Madness" alongside Hiroko Shigezumi for the Square Enix game Heavy Metal Thunder.
Birthplace: Tokyo, Japan Website (artist page) Oomori Toshiyuki is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and musician.
Worked for ADV Films and currently Funimation. He's an ADR Director, Recording engineer, and voice actor for numerous works.
Worked for ADV Films and currently Funimation. He's an ADR Director, Recording engineer, and voice actor for numerous works.

Youko Takahashi is a Japanese singer, known for performing the opening and endings of several anime.

• "A Cruel Angel's Thesis" (残酷な天使のテーゼ), the opening theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "FLY ME TO THE MOON -4 BEAT VERSION-", the ending theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "Souls Refrain" (魂のルフラン), the ending theme to [Evangelion: Death and Rebirth](https://anilist.co/anime/31/)
• "Friends" (フレンズ), the fourth ending theme to [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) (as YAWMIN)
• "metamorphose" the opening theme to [Kono Minikuku mo Utsukushii Sekai](https://anilist.co/anime/146/)
• "Yoake Umarekuru Shoujo" (夜明け生まれ来る少女), the ending theme to [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/anime/355/)
• "Aoki Flamme" (蒼き炎), the opening theme to [Pumpkin Scissors](https://anilist.co/anime/1538/)

• "A Cruel Angel's Thesis" (残酷な天使のテーゼ), the opening theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "FLY ME TO THE MOON -4 BEAT VERSION-", the ending theme to [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/)
• "Souls Refrain" (魂のルフラン), the ending theme to [Evangelion: Death and Rebirth](https://anilist.co/anime/31/)
• "Friends" (フレンズ), the fourth ending theme to [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) (as YAWMIN)
• "metamorphose" the opening theme to [Kono Minikuku mo Utsukushii Sekai](https://anilist.co/anime/146/)
• "Yoake Umarekuru Shoujo" (夜明け生まれ来る少女), the ending theme to [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/anime/355/)
• "Aoki Flamme" (蒼き炎), the opening theme to [Pumpkin Scissors](https://anilist.co/anime/1538/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/秋山勝仁)

Acknowledged for his work in the [Inazuma Eleven](https://anilist.co/anime/5231/) franchise and numerous [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/) shows in the '90s.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/秋山勝仁)

Acknowledged for his work in the [Inazuma Eleven](https://anilist.co/anime/5231/) franchise and numerous [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/) shows in the '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.
Known for his involvement in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/) franchise.

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

George Edmond Manley is an American voice artist, adaptation writer, novelist and screenplay writer. He attended San Jose State University, majoring in theatre arts, University of Nevada, Reno, majoring in journalism and holds his associate of science degree in Computer Information Systems from Morrision University and trained at San Francisco's Voice One Studio and with Braintracks Audio's Nancy Wolfson in commercial and character voiceover.    Manley has performed voice work for several ADV Films productions, including Francesco in the second volume of Noir; Impact, the giant robot in Legend of the Mystical Ninja; Hyugi Zeravire from Super Heavyweight God Gravion Zwei; Barba from Hakugei: Legend of The Moby Dick; and the English-language narrator for Kagaku Ninjatai Gatchaman.    Additionally, he has written adaptation scripts for the last six episodes of Gantz, and is the series writer for the newest adaptation of Super Dimension Fortress Macross, 009-1, Coyote Ragtime Show, Pumpkin Scissors and Kadokawa USA's Full Metal Panic! The Second Raid.    Manley was encouraged to become a voice artist after meeting and receiving encouragement at the 2002 FanimeCon from voice artist Amanda Winn-Lee; voice artist Tiffany Grant and her husband ADV Films president Matt Greenfield.    Manley is also an on-air personality for Houston's Taping For The Blind Radio (now known as Turning Sight Into Sound Radio), currently reading the Houston Chronicle and Sports Illustrated on a weekly basis.
